main event: On May 7, 1965, a family in Oxford, Michigan observed a shiny, oval object in the sky.
interesting points: The object was initially spotted by a 12-year-old boy while birdwatching with his father and sister., The father used 6x30 binoculars and described the object as stationary with a bright area that reflected sunlight., While observing, the father reported seeing what appeared to be a copper-colored object separating from the bright object., The entire sighting lasted approximately 1 minute 5 seconds before the object faded behind cloud cover., The observers concluded that the object did not resemble any known aircraft or satellite.
sighted object: a shiny, oval object in the sky
witness description: A father, his 12-year-old son, and his 7-year-old daughter.
